result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R. Krienke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges.
*   State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.
May not have contact with Roseann D, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Margaret Drees. DE appears in custody with Atty William Michel. Victim present in court.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1057 -   Victim rights compliance. Victim statement. Sentence recommendations made. Defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.  DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 161 days sentence credit. Court costs ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. DE may not have contact with Roseann D. Restitution to be determined by the State within 60 days. Firearms warning, Voters rights,  Appeal rights given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1 and 3 - Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Michel is completing his investigation.  FPT adj. to 2/25/16 at 9:20.  Bond continued.
